data.title: Mastermind
data.statement:
This exercise is inspired by the board game <<Mastermind>>, which is a code-breaking game for two players.

The first player chooses 4 digits and positions them in the order of his choice.
The digits are between 0 and 9 and the same digit can be selected several times.

The second player then chooses 4 digits which he orders as he wishes.

Print {{WIN}} if the guess is the same as the code, otherwise the number of correctly guessed digits :
- Each well-placed digit is indicated by the symbol {{x}}.
- Each misplaced digit is indicated by the symbol {{o}}.
- The correctly placed digits are indicated first, then the incorrectly placed digits.
- Other wrong digits are ignored.

A digit can be present several times in the combinations chosen by the players :

<<Examples>>

Line 1 : {{1}}121
Line 2 : {{1}}333
Output : x

Line 1 : {{1}}121
Line 2 : 33{{1}}3
Output : o

Line 1 : {{1}}{{1}}21
Line 2 : {{1}}3{{1}}3
Output : xo

Line 1 : 5{{4}}{{0}}{{1}}
Line 2 : {{1}}{{4}}{{0}}4
Output : xxo
data.stubGenerator:
read first:string(256)
read second:string(256)

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> A number made up of the 4 digits chosen by the [[first]] player
<<Line 2 :>> A number made up of the 4 digits chosen by the [[second]] player
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> {{WIN}} if the guess is correct, or the {{x}} and {{o}} symbols indicating whether the digits present in the solution are well-placed or misplaced. A digit is misplaced if it is present in both clauses but in a different position.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

This exercise is inspired by the board game Mastermind, which is a code-breaking game for two players.

The first player chooses 4 digits and positions them in the order of his choice.
The digits are between 0 and 9 and the same digit can be selected several times.

The second player then chooses 4 digits which he orders as he wishes.

Print WIN if the guess is the same as the code, otherwise the number of correctly guessed digits :
- Each well-placed digit is indicated by the symbol x.
- Each misplaced digit is indicated by the symbol o.
- The correctly placed digits are indicated first, then the incorrectly placed digits.
- Other wrong digits are ignored.

A digit can be present several times in the combinations chosen by the players :

Examples

Line 1 : 1121
Line 2 : 1333
Output : x

Line 1 : 1121
Line 2 : 3313
Output : o

Line 1 : 1121
Line 2 : 1313
Output : xo

Line 1 : 5401
Line 2 : 1404
Output : xxo
Input
Line 1 : A number made up of the 4 digits chosen by the first player
Line 2 : A number made up of the 4 digits chosen by the second player
Output
Line 1 : WIN if the guess is correct, or the x and o symbols indicating whether the digits present in the solution are well-placed or misplaced. A digit is misplaced if it is present in both clauses but in a different position.
Constraints
Example
Input
4289
4289
Output
WIN
